column5: Well, I made it up to Blindfold Lake yesterday and fished about half a day yesterday and all day today. Water is super high, fishing is great. Ive had my hand on several walleye, a few large pike, and a few big smallies. Wind finally drove us in today. Hope to make it over to LOTW tomorrow. http://img.tapatalk.com/d/14/07/07/ave9ype5.jpghttp://img.tapatalk.com/d/14/07/07/yga3u4yt.jpg

Nice pics. I don't fish on Blindfold but usually fish the area near the portage. Is the water still flowing over the railway/portage system? First time I have ever seen that was this year. I can see from your pics that the water is high.
No. The water is not rolling over the portage. LOTW is only about a foot below blindfold though.

Good to hear you finally made it to Kenora. LOW has been very good as of late for walleye. I don't think they are fully on their summer humps yet but it seems you can get a few at almost any place you stop and jig. Depths from 15 to 40 feet with the bigger ones seem to be deeper. I have mostly concentrated on off islands drops and off mainland points. Mid lake humps are starting but still not concentrated. Lots of jumbo perch this year.
Got out on blindfold ahead of the storm and kept a couple of perch and then got bit by this monster. 36" 10lbs. http://img.tapatalk.com/d/14/07/08/eqyty9ah.jpg

A couple more pics. Fishing was up and down. Great when cloudy but if the sun got out you could forget it. I also caught a big pike via it biting onto a crappie that I was reeling in. That was awesome. http://img.tapatalk.com/d/14/07/12/ubysasys.jpghttp://img.tapatalk.com/d/14/07/12/ze3e4u9y.jpghttp://img.tapatalk.com/d/14/07/12/nu8yjene.jpg
Pat, Love that area, was there in June, had a great week of weather believe it or not !
